intro: Psychrogeton aellenii, commonly known as the Antarctic hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the extreme environments of Antarctica. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is adapted to survive in cold, nutrient-poor soils. The plant has short, dense tussocks and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom during the brief Antarctic summer. Its survival strategies include a deep root system and the ability to remain dormant for long periods. Psychrogeton aellenii plays a vital role in the ecological stability of its harsh habitat.
